comment: Unclear assignment instructions and extremely rude over emails. Teaching assistants will be teaching 100% of this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: This is the worst professor I've taken, he grades everything strictly
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: All tests and quizzes are lockdown, but that is how it is with most accounting classes, and he gives you plenty of resources to do well on them. TONS of extra credit, which not only helps your grade but majorly helps you in the class. I advise you to take this professor he is great and very easy to reach when you have questions. Makes ACCT easy.
Do not take this class

Accounting is hard. There really is no way to make it easy, but Professor Woodward gives plenty of feedback and is accesible outside he is very understanding. Also plenty of extra credit.

It was a diffcult semester for me and if it weren't for him and with the help of countless tutors I wouldn't have gotten this grade.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I enjoyed this class. Mostly self-taught, but he was accessible outside of class. For online lectures, I didnt bother watching them- just going over the powerpoint. I found that practicing problems from homework, guides, bonuses, etc. was most helpful for exams. DO THE REVIEWS! Exams are mainly repeat questions. Lockdown& webcam, no notes.

I will say the content in acct 2200 is hard, but Professor Woodward didnt help too much. It was in the middle of covid so ill give some credit that he tried his hardest, and listened to the students. Very accessible outside class, but in class was just going over practice problems. Textbook helped me a lot in understanding the concepts.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: He is the best accounting professor! He gives you a lot of opportunities for extra points and is a very caring professor. I would definitely recommend that you take him. Although there is a lot of homework and in class assignments, but he makes Accounting class easy to pass.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dont take the professor if you want to be taught accounting. He doesnt teach he just assigns work and tells you to figure it out during the 30 minute timed assessment. If you dont figure it out on your own, you fail. I would highly recommend nobody taking him. By far the worst professor Ive had so far.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Get ready to read

comment: I dont understand why he has such bad reviews. He had the worst reviews out of any professor Ive had so I was expecting a horrible experience but hes in the top 3 of best professors Ive ever had. Accounting is hard and its through connect but he cant control that so just try to understand connect.

Goes off topic way too much from what the topic is. Whenever you ask him a question during lecture he often misses the point/motivation behind the question. Uses jargon for students new to accounting. He often doesn't work through problems himself, but shows powerpoints from the book as if that is enough. Avoid this prof! "How to make an A" my a**.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Prof Woodward is a very nice guy, but his head seems scrambled. It seems hard for him to process and relay information and it affects his teaching. Lots of busy work and tests can be difficult. Grading criteria for extra credit seems to keep changing throughout the class, so don't count on him saving you.

To add some context, I was in the middle of my summer semester and I had missed a couple of assignments out of the thousands that are due for this course. I was currently failing and I probably would have ended up failing if it weren't for Prof. Woodwards helpfulness and availability. Great guy, just a hard course.

Dr. Woodward is very kind and helpful. The online class didn't get accounting lectures, so I'm not sure about the other reviews, but for me the textbook and his occasional supplemental material was more than fine to do well. He wants you to do well and gave extensive extra credit opportunities to our class. I'd recommend him fully.

Like other reviews have stated, Professor Woodward can get a bit thrown off during a lecture. However, he gives PLENTY of nice organized notes and helpful information to make up for it. This class requires a lot of homework/quizzes/exams but if you put the work in, youre good to go.
Professor Woodward is a good person but he can be very disorganized in his lectures. If you do your homework and quizzes, you should do well in this class. 3 exams.
Nice man . He can be a bit disorganized . Id recommend him .
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He was a very kind and charismatic professor. He has your best interest at heart. I do not disagree that he knew the material he was teaching but I would never take this class again. He would take things that I understood and make them 10x more confusing. Again, wonderful person, not the best at explaining. Lectures dragged on and only PowerPoint.

He is very nice and helpful but his lectures are confusing and disorganized. He often confused himself and I found it hard to pay attention in the class. I honestly learned everything from the textbook and homework. He gives a lot of chances for extra credit though and it is fairly easy to get an A.

Hes honestly a nice guy who knows what hes talking about. But hes extremely unorganized and scatter brained. Hes hard to follow and doesnt make much sense. Hes more focused on telling you how to get questions right instead of helping you understand the material. :/

Terrible teacher when it comes to accounting. Frequently mixes up how to do problems and ends up being corrected by the own class he's teaching. If you do end up taking him, dont bother showing up to class as you wont learn anything. Everything you need is online. 2 stars cuz he's at least a kind guy that will work to help you pass.

At first, he sounds like he knows what he's doing. Not sure if it's because he is getting old, but he often gets confused. He was going over the most missed questions on our timed quiz, and he took longer trying to tell us how to answer them. The entire class figured out how to answer the questions before he did, even if we did not know before.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Highly recommend taking his class! He can be unorganized and kind of confusing at times but all the work, notes, and tests are online. I rarely showed up to class and got an A.

Professor Woodward can be a bit unorganized and confused at times. However, he really is a great guy that will take as much time needed to ensure his students understand the material he is presenting. I can appreciate his genuine concern for the success of his students.
